textos_fuente.text: About us | Valiant Air Command, Inc. top of page Web Shop Help Center Call Us (321) 268-1941 Home About us Blog Group Tours Events Monthly Fly In Breakfast Upcoming Events 2025 Titusville Mayors Ball Collection All Aircraft Flying Aircraft Pre War – WWI Post War – WWI / WWII Korean War Vietnam & Cold War Modern Era Restoration Area Artifacts Donation Page Get Involved Commemorative Bricks Memberships Events Volunteer Archive & Form Downloads Social Media Stem Program More Use tab to navigate through the menu items. Hours of Operation Cost of Admission Adult Admission: $22.00 Senior/Military Admission: $20.00 Student Admission (Ages 13–18): $10.00 Children’s Admission (Ages 5–12): $5.00 Group Rates Available: Contact Us for Scheduling and Pricing How to get here Address 6600 Tico Road, Titusville, Florida 32780 321-268-1941 Notice about pets In light of the Valiant Air Command Museum's positioning within an operational airport, safety and environmental considerations are paramount, necessitating a restriction of any and all pet animals on site. However, we warmly accommodate certified service animals, with the condition that they are kept on a leash at all times to safeguard their own  well-being as well as that of their owners, and to maintain the safety of our environment. Notice about the 2025 Airshow Thank you for your interest in the 2025 Space Coast Warbird AirShow. Please be advised that our 2025 airshow has been rescheduled to March 2026, as announced on October 3rd on our Facebook page. This decision was made by our Board of Directors due to Titusville Airport’s planned runway resurfacing project, scheduled to begin in February 2025 and anticipated to last approximately four months. For the latest updates, please refer to the pinned post on our Facebook page Valiant Air Command Facebook . Thank you for your continued support and understanding. We look forward to welcoming you to an even bigger and better event in 2026. Contact Us Please note we do have an FAQ for most questions available - Located Here: - FAQ Center First name Last name Email Write a message I have read the FAQ - View FAQ Submit Thanks for submitting! Our website team will be in contact with you. Sponsors and Supporters As a private, 501(c)(3) non-profit, the Valiant Air Command, Inc. would not exist without the support of donors and volunteers. It is because of the generosity of individuals, corporations and the public sector that we can continue to maintain the ongoing restoration, preservation and educational programs that take place. bottom of page

Volunteer | Valiant Air Command, Inc. top of page Web Shop Help Center Call Us (321) 268-1941 Home About us Blog Group Tours Events Monthly Fly In Breakfast Upcoming Events 2025 Titusville Mayors Ball Collection All Aircraft Flying Aircraft Pre War – WWI Post War – WWI / WWII Korean War Vietnam & Cold War Modern Era Restoration Area Artifacts Donation Page Get Involved Commemorative Bricks Memberships Events Volunteer Archive & Form Downloads Social Media Stem Program More Use tab to navigate through the menu items. Volunteer with Us! Volunteers are the backbone of the Valiant Air Command. We operate with a minimum of paid staff and our community of Volunteers is responsible for most of the major activities in the museum – from maintaining and flying aircraft, to educating and guiding our visitors or to organizing our social and special events – we are always looking for good people to join the VAC family. Many volunteers start out as Tour Guides in our museum, then move into an area that interests them. We ask for a minimum commitment of 4 hours a week, but most people do much more. Our volunteers are from a cross-section – some have spent years in aviation, some have no prior experience with warbirds but are interested in finding a rewarding opportunity to support the community. The minimum age for volunteer applications is 18 – there is no upper age requirement! Current Volunteer Login Volunteer Today! You must check the box to subscribe Home Destinations USA Europe Africa & The Middle East Asia Australia & The Pacific Canada Caribbean Mexico & Central America South America View All Destinations Hotels Travel News Cruises Cruise Overview Cruise News Cruising 101 Cruise Directory Forums Africa & the Middle East Asia Australia & the Pacific Canada Caribbean Europe Mexico & Central America South America United States Air Travel Cruises Travel Tips & Trip Ideas Forums Help View All Forums Trip Ideas National Parks Best Road Trips in America Ultimate Guides Login Subscribe Northeast Coast Overview Hotels Restaurants Sights Top Places Shopping Nightlife Performing Arts Gallery More Northeast Coast Things to Do Northeast Coast Travel Guide Overview Hotels Restaurants See Top Places Shopping Nightlife Arts Gallery Sights Shopping Nightlife Performing Arts Fodor's Expert Review Valiant Air Command Warbird Museum & Tico Airshow Titusville Family Don't judge a book by its cover: what's inside this very ordinary-looking building is extraordinary. Operated mostly through the efforts of an enthusiastic team of volunteers, the museum has an impressive collection of memorabilia and aircraft from World Wars I and II, Korea, Vietnam and more recent conflicts, as well as extensive displays of vintage military flying gear and uniforms. There are posters that were used to help identify Japanese planes, plus a Huey helicopter and the cockpit of an F-106 that you can sit in. In the north hangar a group of dedicated aviation volunteers busily restores old planes. It's an inspiring sight, and a good place to hear some war stories. In the spring the museum puts on the Tico Warbird Airshow, featuring fighter and bomber aircraft that formerly flew in combat around the world. The lobby gift shop sells real flight suits, old flight magazines, bomber jackets, books, models, and T-shirts. Family History Museum Quick Facts 6600 Tico Rd. Titusville Florida - TICO Warbird Airshow - Press Releases Warbird Airshow March 14, 15, and 16, 2014 Valiant Air Command 6600 Tico Road, Titusville, FL 32780 321-268-1941 — vacinfo1@bellsouth.net Valiant Air Command Warbird Museum website Press Releases This information may be used freely by magazines, newspapers, newsletters, etc. to let your readers know about our airshow. It will be updated periodically as new information comes available. If you need larger pictures, please contact us. If you could send us a copy of the publication, it would be greatly appreciated. Press TICO Airshow Hold Harmless Agreement February 27, 2014 -- PRESS RELEASE VALIANT AIR COMMAND PRESENTS THE 37th ANNUAL TICO WARBIRD AIR SHOW Titusville, FL – The Valiant Air Command will host the 37th Annual TICO Warbird Airshow on Friday, March 14; Saturday, March 15 and Sunday, March 16, 2014. This year's program will be a special tribute to the Tuskegee Airmen and the missions they flew in their Red Tail P-51 Mustangs protecting U.S. bombers in Europe during WW II. Loaded with entertainment for the whole family, each day's activities will include a three-hour aerial performance by over 40 aircraft from WW I, WW II, Korean and Vietnam flying formations and demonstrations of parachute jumps and simulated dog fights. Additionally, military and civilian aircraft will be on display and military re-enactors and firepower will be demonstrated. Flight simulators, airplane and helicopter rides will be available. Other entertainment will include a car display, a midway with rides, an autograph tent and more. The TICO Warbird Airshow will be held at the Space Coast Regional Airport, 6600 Tico Road, Titusville 32780. Gates open at 8:30 a.m. each day. Advanced admission is $15.00 for adults and $5.00 for children 5 to 8 years of age. Tickets will be an additional $5.00 at the gate. Some activities require special tickets. For more information on activities, times they are scheduled and to purchase tickets online, please visit the AirShow website or call 321-268-1941. The Valiant Air Command Warbird Museum is a 501(c) 3 Educational Museum, non-profit, dedicated to the preservation of aviation history for future generations. Ron Davis Public Relations Officer Valiant Air Command 6600 Tico Road Titusville FL 32780 321-268-1941 PICK UP TICKETS LOCALLY These photos may be used in conjunction with publicity for the VAC TICO Warbird Airshows. Valiant Air Command Warbird Museum - Visit Space Coast Skip to main content Item Added to Itinerary My Planner Share My Itinerary Added to Wishlist Copied to Clipbord Surf Cams Map Local Weather Explore Fall is for Foodies Kennedy Space Center Visitor Complex Port Canaveral Wildlife Viewing Cocoa Beach Brevard Zoo Things To Do Sea Turtle Season Attractions Beaches Communities Restaurants Tours Museums Stay Bed and Breakfast Campgrounds Hotels Vacation Rentals Events Blogs Launches My Itinerary Visitor Information Vacation Planner Accessibility on the Space Coast Beach Safety Transportation and Map Search for: Search Follow Us on Social Media facebook-f instagram youtube pinterest-p Search for: Search Home Things to Do Valiant Air Command Warbird Museum Add to Wishlist Valiant Air Command Warbird Museum At the Valiant Air Command Warbird Museum maintains and restores all types of aircraft indigenous to the world’s military forces, from pre-WWI to the present. See these aircrafts on display in two hangars, and if you’re lucky, you may see the team in action restoring a plane. History buffs will also love poring through the memorabilia. Join them on the second Saturday of every month at 8 a.m. for the Fly-In Breakfast. The Valiant Air Command Warbird Air Museum is happy to announce that it is now open five days a week (Wednesdays through Sundays) from 9-5. Visit our website at www.valiantaircommand.com for additional information. Welcome to Valiant Air Command, Inc. Step into history at the Valiant Air Command, Inc. Warbird Air Museum, where aviation comes to life! Located just 12 miles (5 minutes) from NASA’s Kennedy Space Center Visitor Complex, we feature over 50 different aircraft, from pre-WWI to modern-day jets. Our collection includes meticulously restored warbirds, offering a glimpse into aviation’s rich history. Explore our hangars, learn about aviation's role in shaping the world, and experience special events like airshows and Fly-In Breakfasts. Whether you're an aviation enthusiast or just looking for a unique experience, there's something for everyone! And don’t forget to stop by our well-stocked gift shop for a variety of aviation memorabilia and unique souvenirs to remember your visit. Pricing Valiant Air Command Warbird Museum Admission Pricing Discover aviation history at an affordable price for the whole family! ​ 🎟️ Admission Rates: Adults: $20 Seniors (Military & Veterans): $18 Children (5-12): $10 Children Under 5: Free Group Rates Available ​ See Full Pricing Details and plan your visit today! Tickets are available at the door—no online sales. Directions Visit the Valiant Air Command Warbird Museum Plan your trip and explore aviation history up close! 📍 Location: 6600 Tico Road, Titusville, FL 32780 🚗 Easy Access: Just off I-95, Exit 223 Get Directions with Google Maps and start your journey today! We look forward to seeing you soon. Hours of Operation Plan your visit and experience aviation history firsthand! 🕘 Hours: Monday - Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM The museum is open year-round, with exceptions for major holidays. Check ahead for special events or closures. We look forward to welcoming you! Sponsors and Supporters As a private, 501(c)(3) non-profit, the Valiant Air Command, Inc. would not exist without the support of donors and volunteers. It is because of the generosity of individuals, corporations and the public sector that we can continue to maintain the ongoing restoration, preservation and educational programs that take place. bottom of page
